website_summaries.verdict: Utilitarian casing hides a very powerful charger that provides up to 40 amps, making it a good choice for larger-capacity EV batteries.
pros: With full 40 amp capacity, charges most EV batteries within 3 to 4 hours
Output can be reduced if desired
Companion smartphone app tracks charging rate and other stats
Once installed, is fairly intuitive to use
cons: Most owners will need to run a 50 amp circuit to the charger’s install point – or charge at a reduced 20 amp rate if their circuit box is too old
May not work with Mercedes B-class vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 15 months!  Not Happy!
customer_reviews.text: The unit broke after 15 months with 5-beep error. Contacted support for advanced replacement. Received replacement but the replacement unit is in very poor condition. The J1772 is all scratched with some white plastic coming off. (My original unit is in perfect condition) Contacted support again and asked to return the replacement unit and to perform warranty repair on my original unit. They refused my request to repair my original unit. Sent more emails to support but no more replies! NOT HAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: (After our electrician ran a 50 amp circuit to the garage) WiFi option is nice, but not 100 pct required if your car ...
customer_reviews.text: JuiceBox Pro 40 charges our 2015 BMW i3 REX in 3.5 hours from flat. Far less than the $2,000 quoted by BMW to install their charger. Took less than ten minutes to hang and install. (After our electrician ran a 50 amp circuit to the garage) WiFi option is nice, but not 100 pct required if your car connects to Internet. So far so good. Will update in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Gundo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install as garage had a 240 outlet for ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install as garage had a 240 outlet for welder. Like ability to delay charge till 2 am via app. Unit needs a LED to show it has power. Seems I need a 3.5 hour charge time after wife has done her 40 mile round trip to work. Emails notices ... now add texting! ###### Need button on box to allow 'CHARGE NOW' pain if you have set to charge after midnight which works 80% of time for us and one afternoon you want an early charge you have to find phone with app or login to web service to over-ride. 5 stars when few of these and what others bring up are improved on.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcett

customer_reviews.title: no way to lock charger
customer_reviews.text: I am an electrician and installed hundreds of different charger over the years When you buy $550 outdoor plugin charger you expect it to come with a lock Someone can unplug it and take it in 1 minutes
customer_reviews.author: gila

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, nonexistent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Cord heavy and stiff. Stopped working after less than two months. Customer service impossible to reach, and I live less than 30 miles away. Do yourself a favor and buy something less expensive because this charger was an absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F

customer_reviews.title: Good charger, Useless App
customer_reviews.text: Good looking charger that installed easily. Charges my Chevy Bolt EV without issue. Very happy from that perspective. Charging cable is nice and long. Only complaint is that there is almost no practical utility to the app and having this thing WiFi connected. The application is largely useless. It can't accurately tell you how much charge time is left, current percent charged, etc. I would never trust this thing to smart-charge to a specific level due to its inaccuracies. Getting a notification if you forget to plug in is great, but it's unreliable. I've forgotten to plug in 4 times over several months but only received a notification twice. Save money and energy and buy a charger without WFi connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: wifi stop working-Replacement was an old model, used, different box
customer_reviews.text: The box stopped connecting to wifi after about three months.The box won't stay connected to the servers. I've worked with their support staff. They blame my wifi system even though every client on in except theirs works fine. I paid for something that I didn't get, namely the ability to use the wifi capability of the charger. Very disappointed in the product and the company. The seller offered a replacement. Replacement was an OLD model, USED, different box
customer_reviews.author: B1

customer_reviews.title: 3 Warrenty replacements in 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the Juice Box, when it is working, but in less than 2 years, our juice box has had to be replaced 3x! This is a very large inconvenience and hassle. Each time it is replaced under warrantee. What happens when my warrantee is up? There is something defective in their design or manufacture of the 32A product. 2 of the times it broke, there was a loud pop and smell from the box, luckily our breaker flipped. The other time it would not recognize it was connected to the car. 3 warranty claims in less than 2 years is not acceptable
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Juice Box's Internet Connectivity Saved The Day!
customer_reviews.text: Strongly recommend this product! My car would not charge at full strength when I first got my Juicebox, and I really struggled to figure out why it was not working. Thanks to its internet connection, Juicebox support was able to notice that my charger was receiving 120 volts, instead of the full 240 volts that the outlet should have provided (thanks, Emily!). An electrician that I brought out immediately found a wiring mistake, fixed it, and my 2017 Chevy Volt is now happily charging at its full capability. If the charger had come without internet connectivity (like some of its competition), I never would have found the mistake, and never would have been able to fully use any charger!
customer_reviews.author: GRC

customer_reviews.title: Charger is great.  Software and interface still needs work.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, install, and connect to WiFi. Charges the car well, as expected with its ratings and power. The online interface needs some work. Couldn't get it to correctly save my local electricity rates or local gasoline prices, which are used for a cool feature to show the cost per mile savings of EV per mile and over time. Calling tech support did not fix it on the call, but the support lady was very, very nice and implemented the changes to my account a couple days later, after escalating the issue internally. Didn't waste my time. Just did it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Great charger - wifi died at 3 mos
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fine charger. Wifi-enabled so you can program it to charge at off-peak hours (cheaper electricity rates, and in some areas that feature increases your rebate). Install & setup was a breeze. Download the app, create account, and off you go. Installation is just locking it onto a wall bracket you install - meaning you can take it off the wall easily if you move/travel. Downside was that wifi function died after 2 1/2 months. Called support and they were quite helpful & immediately sent me a replacement. The good news is that the unit was able to charge my car after wifi died, just not on a pre-defined schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Austin G

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The JuiceBox was easy to install on the wall, it charges my Kona EV without issues. But, the WiFi feature doesn't work. We tried multiple devices (iPhone, Android, PC, Mac, Chromebook), none of them could find the WiFi. I called their tech support, they sent a replacement. The replacement's WiFi doesn't work. I searched online, the WiFi -- or lack of WiFi -- seems to be a common issue.
customer_reviews.author: L. Keith

customer_reviews.title: This wall charger is a piece of junk - two units broke
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by flashy app, and cool interface. THE WALL CHARGER IS JUNK. I had two units break in less than four months. While customer service is very responsive, they will not refund any electrician costs incurred for the installation or removal of the hardwired wall charger. I really wanted this product to work, but the hardware is garbage and I would recommend looking at a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Charger great, strange readings from the juicenet app
customer_reviews.text: So far my JuiceBox 40 pro works great. It’s installed on a 50 amp circuit. The only question or issue I have is how it reports charging miles from the JuiceNet app. I have a 2012 Chevy volt and selected it as my car in the app. Charging from depleted battery to full only reported 17 miles gained in the app. The car itself showed a full charge. I also charged with 10 miles range left, but the app only showed 5 miles gained when it was fully charged. I also get notifications during the day that my car is charging, even though it isn’t plugged in and nowhere near the charger. Other than those quirks, everything works fine.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Ehmke

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it works.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago. At first it was amazing it was all that I need. The WiFi never worked well since I got it. I never really cared for the WiFi so no biggie. Then a few days ago the charger took a dump. The light bar went dead and the charge rate drop to level one speeds. Lucky the customer service was decent. I had to pay 200 deposit for them to send me another unit. They haven’t confirm my shipment. I went on reddit and this seems to be a known problem after a WiFi update. If this happens again in a few months I’ll be returning it and buying another charger.
customer_reviews.author: rene

customer_reviews.title: Can be downgraded from 40A Manually
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this product for me was that you can downgrade to a lower amperage when charging using the app. My box kept getting flipped because of the poor electrical wiring job in the house. I kept lowering the amperage a little bit until it found a good equilibrium. I am now running this at 24 amps, but it is nice to know you can up it back to 40 if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Silmarilos

customer_reviews.title: Software Instruction Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This company clearly has an inability to develop software for its product. The installation app is not even mentioned in the documentation that comes with the product. The incorrect english tips their hand that they had developers who are not native speakers, and hence the instructions are awful. It should not be this difficult to install an app and connect to a product. I just hope the charger holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: We have two Fusion plug-in hybrids. Their charging speed is 220V/16A. So it is not pushing this charger to its limits. This is my second unit. The first one worked without a fuss for three weeks. Then it started giving errors (The same error at three separate times. One long beep and a short break) Restarting the unit did not solve the issue. I unplugged it for a day. Then it worked. It happened three times in the last week of the 30 days return frame of Amazon. I requested a replacement. The replacement is working fine so far. I hope it does not start causing issues too.
customer_reviews.author: Ensar Demirkan

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for EV charging
customer_reviews.text: I've had the new JuiceBox 2.0 for about 2 months now and it's been working well. As a charger, it's what you'd hope for - plug and play. The cable is good and long, so it's been easy to use. The feature which attracted me to the Juice Box specifically is the app integration, which allows you to track usage etc. This is much as others have reported where it's a bit tricky to ensure the box picks up the house WiFi network, but as long as it does then everything is solid and reliable. So the trick here is a good WiFi repeater near the juice box. All in all, very happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Doug

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good - App update please.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Really like this charger so far. I only left a 4 star review instead of a 5 because of the app. I hope in a future version of the app, you will be able to shedule daily/weekly charging times. I bought this charger so I can plug the car in when I get home and then wait until off-peak hours to charge. You can do this, but you have to do it in the app every time you plug the car in. If I could set up a weekly schedule for charging times, that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Charles Halford

customer_reviews.title: A great value: try to find another L2 charger with this many features for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product from a company with great customer service. If you compare the options for level 2 chargers, it's hard to argue there are any others with more capability: high current L2 charging, Wifi connectivity, smartphone app, long charging cable. There are more expensive units out there with far fewer features. I had problems with the WiFi connection on the first unit I received, but the customer service department was very helpful in getting me a replacement very quickly and it works very well. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mst3k4eva

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I don't have WI-FI available because the charger is outside and out of range for my wi-fi. hence, no comment on Alexa integration. Next, I had to have an electrician install it because I needed a 240 line out to my driveway, so no install opinions. Finally, it worked and then after a month it did not. Called Juice Box, they knew what the problem was and I had a new box in 3 days. New box working fine. Communication with them was great and I have the e-mail of the person who helped me if I have any other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Otis

customer_reviews.title: BMW i3 Charger
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2017 BMW i3 and installed it in the garage on the wall. The electricians came and installed a 220 outlet and I was charging. The app, while a bit clumsy to get setup, works but I rarely use it. The hardware of this charger is bare bones - there are no lights or visual indicators that it's on, off, working or not. You basically rely on your vehicle to tell you those things. That said, it works well for me and the long cord is a bonus since it is capable of reaching either side of the garage in case we add a 2nd EV in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Bold and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Yikes, this Lvl 2 charger is a BEAST!!!! I had the electrician professionally install the outlet with a 50 amp switch, plugged it in the wall, had a little difficult getting it setup on WiFi, the trick is to use 10.10.10.1 in the address bar of your browser, once I did that, connection was made quick!. The diameter of the cable is huge and looks like it will last a lifetime. Very impressed with the app, gives me good information when I want it. Well done JuiceBox.
customer_reviews.author: RDox

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I’ve had it for a bit more than two months and it works perfectly. Connecting it to WiFi was easy, and I’ve used the phone app on both Android and iPhone without a problem. It also can deliver 40 amps vs 32 on most others, and is more than $200 less expensive than the unit that the Chevrolet dealer suggested. In addition, their customer support is outstanding. I got email responses to some basic questions in minutes, even at off hours. Kudos to them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Malagold

customer_reviews.title: Plug-in version cannot be installed as hard-wired
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was cheaper than the Chargepoint. In my town, the plug-in version requires a a GFCI circuit breaker as seems to be now required by the 2020 NEC. This is obviously not workable because of the well-know nuisance tripping issues. The only workaround is to install the unit direct-wired, which the manufacturer would not allow me to do. (Voids the warranty, they said). So that left me no choice other than returning the Juicebox and buying a Chargepoint. Chargepoint allows installing either way, and it is drop-dead simple taking off the included power supply cable.
customer_reviews.author: Coder

customer_reviews.title: Juicebox Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Juicebox over the Siemens model as it seemed to me a more rugged, long-lasting product. My electrician has done other work in the house and he's installed lots of home chargers and this is the first time he's installed a Juicebox and he raved about it and said that it's a "lot better" than the other home chargers he's installed for other clients, more "well-built," "solid," and that this is what he'll buy when he eventually buys an EV. My only complaint is the included cradle is not nearly big enough to securely hold (especially in deep winter) three nearly coiled loops of the charging cable when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Seth DC

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: One week beyond the return date, the unit broke and I had to purchase another! It only lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Michael Halle

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a week of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this charger a few months ago, but had to wait for an electrical panel upgrade which took a while, and then I was finally able to install it. Unfortunately, it worked great for a week, and then failed. Really disappointed. I put in a service ticket but haven't heard back yet. I'd really like to get my money back, as like I said, I only used for a week before it failed.
customer_reviews.author: mcj

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and network integration.
customer_reviews.text: Installed JuiceBox Pro this past weekend to provide 240v charging for both of our EV's (Bolt and Tesla). So far so good. I like the 40amp capability where most chargers I evaluated max out at 32 amps. The dashboard is great for looking at history. I use the iPhone app and like the ability to charge on demand when needed. Setup through our network was easy and straightforward. I ordered the carrying case and adapters in case we need to take it on the road. Cable is hefty so I feel it can take some abuse. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research into the alternatives, I opted for the JuiceBox 40. After about 1 month of usage, I can report that I'm completely satisfied. The initial configuration was really simple and the app works nicely along with the unit. I use this to charge a Hyundai Kona EV and charge times match exactly what the Hyundai specs call for. I also like the web-based reporting available through the Juice.net application. My only minor complaint is that the included plastic charger holster (the one you mount on the wall next to the JuiceBox) is undersized for the thickness of the charging cable. The BougeRV hanger ( makes a more suitable hanger to handle the weight/thickness of the cable.
customer_reviews.author: H. Yermish

customer_reviews.title: Yes ChargePoint 32A was lighter but is NOT portable or removable like the Juice Box Pro
customer_reviews.text: After doing lots of comparing and considering other EV Chargers .... The Juice Box Pro 40 was a no brainer in every category ....Yes ChargePoint 32A was lighter but is NOT portable or removable like the Juice Box Pro ... I couldn't be any happier !! ... Most Public Stage 2 Chargers max at 6.0 Kwh the Juice Box can Charge my New Chevy Bolt at a rate of 7.3 Kwh which is like getting an extra 5 miles of charge per hour of charging. The Quality of the Box and cables are the best i've seen and you'll never have tangle issues which you see with smaller gage cables. Rbaz
customer_reviews.author: Rbaz123

customer_reviews.title: About as easy as it gets
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased our first all electric car. While it was expensive and time consuming to install the second meter in our home, the actual installation of the JuiceBox was simple! Connecting it to our home network was simple as well. I recommend installing a 100amp electrical meter because as electric cars offer the ability to charge over 32 amps, all it will take is to install a different JuiceBox, not the entire electrical meter and wiring.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasPerl

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know why I waited so long
customer_reviews.text: *car was already fully charged from level 1 charger prior to being brought into garage* I ordered my JuiceBox Pro 40 a couple months ago, but we had to make room in the garage and then install wiring and the plug for it. I had been using the 120v occasional use charger singe I go my car in August. I am excited to finally have level 2 charging! It did take me quite a few tries to get the WiFi connected and working.. I had to put my phone on airplane mode with only WiFi on and then go through the setup procedure in the app.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Buy this charger!... If you want quality, security and a first class app!
customer_reviews.text: Having had the Siemens WiFi Versacharge to compare this unit to, I can absolutely assure you that every aspect of this charger speaks to higher quality, vastly improved application security, way better customer service, great install instructions and a much longer, better connection cable. Longer term, this company understands smart grid marketing, they seem to have very high quality staff who demonstrate why Silicon Valley companies understand technology. As one example, the Juice Box security enrollment process incorporates an extra step that allows the home user to install a strong network password with a triple confirm process using the plug and unplug process to confirm that you alone are authenticating the Chargers network enrollment. Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play-- easy install, easy setup, charging within minutes
customer_reviews.text: I like the ruggedness of this charger with it's full metal enclosure. Some others I viewed online look like they have plastic enclosures. It was easy to install with the included brackets. Up and charging my Audi etron in no time at all at more than 8kW. The Wifi setup was quite simple as well, and I was soon setting charge schedules to limit charging during the super-off-peak hours offered by my utility co-op. Only thing I would change about it so far is the cheap-ish plastic bracket that holds the charge cord. A metal bracket with a more substantial holder for the cord would have been nice, especially given the generous cord length.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Hyundai Kona and I ran a 50 amp outlet to my garage for this car. Installed the Juicebox and downloaded the app for Android. Went through the steps on the App. All worked well. The App is pretty good. Charged the car from about 40% to 80% in about 5 hours. Juicebox is not pretty on the wall (a black box) but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jed K

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Kia NIRO PHEV
customer_reviews.text: I tried an EVOCharger before this that kept having an unrecoverable fault. This one replaced it about a month ago and has been solid with no issues. I charge my Kia Niro PHEV (2019)!
customer_reviews.author: Clay Barron

customer_reviews.title: I use it to charge my EV
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it's supposed to. The only flaw is that it refuses to connect to wifi so I can't use any of the features that entails, whatever they may be. I didn't buy it with that in mind so it doesn't matter a lot but it kind of sucks that I can't take advantage of that. There's no point returning it at the moment since I only need it to charge and going a few days without it will limit my mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Clean look and nice design. I don't know anything about electricity so ...
customer_reviews.text: This charging station works as it claims. Clean look and nice design. I don't know anything about electricity so I hired a professional to install this station in my garage since it needs a 220-V outlet. This product was recommended by the sales guy at Selman Chevy in Orange. Pro version comes with Wi-Fi feature which works great. This is the very first charging station I purchased and I'm glad I followed the suggestion from the sales guy at Selman Chevy.
customer_reviews.author: April Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but I will add this functionality to the logs if possible
customer_reviews.text: I would like the logs to store the initial % of charge that I set on the app. That way I would be able to track the state of degradation of the battery. Currently I own a 2017 X5 and I was able to confirm its not charging as I was expecting but it would be easier for me to also be able to log the initial % against the point when it gets to the "100%" so I can track degradation or possible issues through time. I think is an easy feature to add since is only code.
customer_reviews.author: catzelp

customer_reviews.title: High Powered, Easy to Install Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed the JuiceBox Pro 40 one week ago and all is working perfectly. I had my electrician install the 14-50 outlet, so all I that I had to do was hang the unit on the wall and plug it in. I picked the JuiceBox Pro 40 because this model had all the features I was looking for. It offers the maximum output to make it future proof at a reasonable price point and comes with a 3-year warranty. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Wald

customer_reviews.title: Works well but pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review, they updated their app to provide more usable features, like limiting the charge to 80%. The Prius Prime does not have the capability of limiting the charge to 80%. I’m glad the JuiceNet has. Almost a year I’ve had it and have minimal problems with it. Initial problem was with internet connection being that the garage was far from my WiFi router, which was resolved when I installed Orbi mesh WiFi router. And last issue is that it’s pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, great cable, awesome app
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. It was easy to install and configure. The wire is really thick and heavy, which makes it feel top quality and much safer than my other charger. With about 90F in the garage I measured the temperature of the wire and device. Wire did not have any extra heat. There is some warmth feeling in the top middle of the metal chassis but it's mild and it dissipates easily. I had watched reviews in youtube and here in Amazon and the reviews are correct. This is the best product in this price and amperage range!
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and overall great build quality. I hate to call this a downside as the charging cable is extremely thick and over engineered, but I feel it is a little too rigid. Overall I am very pleased with the charger. It works great for charging the e-Tron, which can benefit from the faster charging speed this charger provides when properly installed.
customer_reviews.author: Hifi Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: The best evse,
customer_reviews.text: I bought the plug in to use in more situations about a year ago and this is a great charger. We use on 2 cars, going to buy another one. One feature is you can set the charge rate for 1 to 40 to either match your available power or if you want slower overnight charging, and once you update it, the settings stay even if it's offline. And the app can send you notice if you want when you plug in, start or end charging. Going to buy a second to charge both cars at once.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Charges fast
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly. Just plug in and start charging. Easy to install on the wall. Had to figure out how to coil the hose/wire tobget it out of the way. but once that was done. All good. Charges fast. App allows for scheduling that you can set the timing on. All managed via the iPhone. App easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Dennis & Karen gunther

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The JuiceBox Pro 40 is an awesome product made by an awesome company. I purchased this unit to charge my Fiat 500e. It's connected to my home WiFi network and I use the iPhone app (and occasionally the web page) to control its interface. I've found its operation to be pretty intuitive, so anyone with a pretty basic understanding of mobile applications or computers shouldn't have a problem using this device. Customer service responds to questions promptly and accurately. Material quality and workmanship is top notch. If you're looking for a premium EVSE with a good user interface, the JuiceBox is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: Awesome charger
customer_reviews.text: We had it installed by an electrician but it took him minutes to connect and mount it to the wall. We downloaded the app and we know that we can schedule and control several things but honestly we are just plugging in when we come home (regardless of the time of the day) and unplugging when we need the car. It works great. The charging cord is long and sturdy. It's just perfect and it's a fraction of the cost of what the dealer was gonna charge us for theirs.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Charger automatically records all charging sessions.
customer_reviews.text: I received my JuiceBox promptly. Installation was straight forward and instructions were clear. It is very simple to use, I just plug the end of the charger cord in the car. My electric supplier does not offer different rates at different times, but it will schedule the charges if you want it too. The supplier supplies some information about when the grid has more "green" electricity, so for the environmentally conscious, you can time your charging for those times. The feature I like best is that it keeps a record of all charging sessions. I can look at them on their website and download them as a csv file.
customer_reviews.author: Patton Steuber

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and set up
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and set up. I don't have a garage, so I ran a 50 amp 240v line from the breaker box to a 240v outlet I mounted on the outside of the house. Wire a bit difficult to work with but doable. Then I mounted the charger... Which was easy... And plugged it in. Works great. A couple of tips. Do NOT use a GFI breaker on this circuit. The charger has GFI built in which will trip a GFI breaker constantly. If you have 100 Amp service check with an electrician before adding a 50 amp circuit!!
customer_reviews.author: FrankRN

customer_reviews.title: No manual online, no searchable help
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself has performed well for the year or so I have had it. In going online to find a manual, there is none. The online help is all broken up into categories, and not searchable. So make a guess what you need and keep clicking until you find something or give up. Of the hundred or so products I have bought and gotten manuals for online, this Juicebox 40 is the only product I can think of, even $10 products, that has no discrete, searchable manual.
customer_reviews.author: Steve West

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Install was pretty easy - had an electrician run the circuit and plug in where I wanted it and then mounting the JB is very straight forward. Super simple and classy design, looks great anywhere. The ability to look at it on the app over wi fi is great, and scheduling looks easy. I don't schedule charges because we arent offered a peak/off-peak plan, but if I wanted to it looks simple. Overall worth the money because I believe the Juiicebox will stand the test of time and not become obsolete anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: BigAdge

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Appreciate long cable.
customer_reviews.text: Had this mounted on a pole in our front yard so we can charge on the driveway. Works perfectly. I particularly appreciate the long cable to the car. We charge a Tesla and I was a little worried that it would be unwieldy with the adapter but so far it’s fine. FWIW the Juicebox connects to our home wi-fi more consistently than the Tesla does. I like that the app provides an additional way to monitor charging status. Haven’t tried the Alexa integration yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon loyalist

customer_reviews.title: Works great but Alexa support is nothing
customer_reviews.text: Works well in every way that matters, email notifications, and of course charging. I did choose this model for the alexa support, but it turns out that just means alexa sees it as a generic power socket. So all it can do is turn the charger off and on. Other models allow status checks and other useful things, this model does almost nothing helpful.
customer_reviews.author: George M. Fricke

customer_reviews.title: Kicks the bracker off.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for about 2 months. Now it kicks the bracker off as soon as plugged in. The manufacturer replied with some suggestion, that does not work. Then no responds from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: EV Home Charger Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: I love that I now have total peace of mind having my own electric vehicle charger at home. My EV’a range is not great so I was suffering from anxiety thinking I would run out of charge before getting home or to work. No more!! This product charges my car fast (relatively 3.5-4 hours) and at home. No issues at all since its installation. I am very happy with this purchase. Highly recommend it to all EV owners!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Sanchez-Osorio

customer_reviews.title: Multiple defective units sent to me
customer_reviews.text: I had nothing but problems with multiple units. The first unit didn't work right out of the box, it was determined that handset was defective. They then sent out another unit that worked for a while but then it started making a sizzling sound and it would not charge. I found out that it was a refurbished unit. They then sent out another unit and it worked for a week and then the sizzling sound started again and it showed as a fault and would not charge. So I sent it back for refund and bought a chargepoint unit and I have had no issues with the chargepoint.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive WiFi capable charger for our little EV. In areas that are more EV friendly than ours, it might be even better (no demand charging or on/off prime rates), but it does exactly what I need. Easy to install, setup and use. I haven't tried the Alexa integration, but I am sure it works, everything else has. I do wish it could tell us the current charge state of our car, but such is life. I don't think any do that and the wireless connection service from Mercedes-Benz was terminated last year with no recourse for any of these smart cars.
customer_reviews.author: JackInTN

customer_reviews.title: Seamless
customer_reviews.text: I researched all of our options for a level 2 charger for our Chevy Bolt and this came highly recommended. It works great and I love having the app to be able to control how much I want it to charge and also monitor where it’s at in charging. The best feature is that it helps calculate how much you’re saving which is always nice to see.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Eno

customer_reviews.title: Good EV charger
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of research before purchasing this. Our licensed electrician installed the unit, we plug in our EV and... it didn’t charge the car. We called tech support and they suggested we jiggle the handle and push it up, which did allow the charger to work with our RAV4 EV. The charger also doesn’t fit in the holster when it’s not charging with tech support said it normal but that’s odd to us given there is a hole to secure it in place. Hopefully we don’t have a defective product. Tech support was nice and helpful, we didn’t wait long to speak with someone. We are overall happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, very easy to install and to use. Able to charge the car during nonpeak hours to save you money on electricity. It is a very fast charger, so you don't have to charge for long hours. Overall very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: aailaw

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have for Home Electric Vehicle Owners
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to EVs, and just bought a 2019 Chevy Bolt. I live in an area with few public charging stations as yet. With this unit I top off the car after a few days of casual use, or daily for longer driving needs. It's temporarily wired to a 240V source close to where the Bolt is currently parked. When our new carport is in place, it'll be relocated there. During off-peak hours the cost is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Smith, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Good Product
customer_reviews.text: We had a 240 volt outlet installed in the garage as a part of our solar panel project last year. This year we ended driving more so the 120 volt charger that came with the car was no longer adequate for us. We bought the plug-in version of the JuiceBox Pro 32. The installation was simple, consisting of drilling a couple of holes and mounting a bracket onto which the unit is hung. The wireless setup was easy with the instructions provided. I have operated the unit for a week and a half with no issues, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Service
customer_reviews.text: This is great product, and service. I have ordered Juicebox Pro 40 and it came on time with no issues. I hired electrician to install 240V output. Apart from that it was smooth. And it's Wifi capability is awesome. You don't need to worry about when to start charging. I have Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid and my car charges in 2 hours, so I prefer charging starts at 3:00 to 5:00 AM, because at that time electric charges are less. So definitely I recommend this product and will update my review if I will find any more or any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Asif Khan

customer_reviews.title: Recommend the charger, not the app
customer_reviews.text: The charger was easy to install (on a recently installed 240V 50A line) and charges both my card as expected. Looks like a solid powerful charger. However, setting up the wifi connection with the phone app was a pain. It would not allow me to specify a hidden ssid and password. This is a basic capability every wifi device should have. Once I set up the wifi (by temporarily opening up the ssid) I realized other issues with the software. It allows entering multiple cars, but does not auto detect them while charging them. The 'added range' numbers are fiction because it assumes you are charging a fully depleted car. The app/website is still useful for getting the charging history.
customer_reviews.author: Sugato Bagchi

customer_reviews.title: when it works....it's great
customer_reviews.text: Has failed twice now within 2 years. Warranty requires a deposit. Mobile app works great, scheduling of charging sessions works well. Just needs to be more reliable
customer_reviews.author: DBLD

customer_reviews.title: Product as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Only have a week experience utilizing the Juicebox 40. My 2018 Leaf has been a happy recipient of the charge provided. I do have a comment as opposed to a complaint. I wonder if an On/Off switch has been considered. I know that it is probably being maintained in the on function for the wifi connectivity but, it would be one less vampirical power usage with the option to turn off. It could then be set to reacquire wifi once re-powered on. Just a thought. No true complaint. Easy install and has been working great! 50A to 30A adapter is great as well. Mahalo!
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Blake

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Went from 20+hours of charging my son's 2015 i3 REX on the standard 110v plug from empty to full to 3 hours flat from empty to full with the Juicebox Pro. He loves this charger. Install was quick and easy from our electrician and everything has been functioning properly. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a relatively inexpensive(compared to the other 40a units), well functioning unit. Not the prettiest looking one compared to some of the others with their sleek designs but as you can see from the garage, it doesn't have to be pretty to work!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Bresalier

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat!  Great EV home charging station! Even highly portable, if you wish to take it with you! :-D
customer_reviews.text: Superb product!! Charges VERY quickly! Great app allows you to monitor and control everything! Wonderful reports can be gathered through your online account via any web browser! Their customer support is great; juts utilize their e-mail support, rather than the phone line. It is also a very compact design. No frills, but also very portable! It is also very weather proof and dependable!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guru M

customer_reviews.title: Decent Level 2 charger with charging stats
customer_reviews.text: Decent level 2 charger. Took a few try's to get Wi-Fi working. Does a decent job giving me a history of KW used for each charge and I can download a report in xls format. For my Chevy Bolt Ev the plug was slightly tight requiring a lot of force to plug in. But after I put a little silicon grease on plug problem was resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer in PA

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.text: Purchase a new hybrid that I take delivery on in September, ran my wires through the attic in April. Its all connected and ready to go, I was a little confused with all the different color lights. I loaded the app and still wasn't sure. One call to tech support, gave them my serial number and they check communication with the unit and I'm all set, just need the dam car to arrive
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Company That Stands Behind The Products It Sells
customer_reviews.text: For me, the mark of a good product is really tested when something doesn't go quite right with the product. The charger wasn't able to connect to my home network out of the box. I worked with their customer service to work through the problems. They determined that there was something wrong with the product. They sent me a new Juicebox with a return label for my old one. The new one I got works great. I am very happy with the service I received. I am very happy that there are still companies that stand behind their products. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a high quality level 2 charger.
customer_reviews.author: One of the Hansen Clan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent charger, Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent charger after 1 year of ownership. Has never failed to charge the car. Easy installation/setup; should take less than a half hour. App is consistently functional and allows me to take advantage of the cheap energy prices of the evening. The warning that you haven't plugged in your car by the time you specify is very helpful! After a year, the Wi-Fi failed and the company quickly shipped me an advanced replacement of a newer version. Again, the charging function never failed, I simply stopped being able to update the schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The charge rate is 10kw/hour
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good charger for my Volt or my Tesla model 3. The app works well and tells you the charge status of either car .. tracks a bunch of other stuff but more importantly for the Tesla it charges the long range battery at a rate of 10 kw per hour. The charger that comes with it charges at 8 kw per hour. I simply had the electrician install the 240v plug in the garage next to where the main electrical panel is and easily amounted the bracket that the juice charger hangs on and that was it. In the 2 car garage the cord reaches the 2016 Volt or the 2018 Tesla model 3.
customer_reviews.author: greg rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not really Tesla 3 compatible
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few issue and all point to fact the charger is not Tesla 3 compatible. I would have returned the unit but it is installed and cost too much to remove and return. I already missed a couple of charging the cost me real issues. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: monty

customer_reviews.title: More than I needed
customer_reviews.text: I want to charge my car. This involves plugging the cable into the charge port of the vehicle. It's pretty simple. So why did I have to spend four hours and two phone calls having to download an app, get the stupid charger to connect to my home wifi and do all this other useless stuff? Definitely an engineer-driven rather than customer-driven product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin F. Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Ev charging
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Had an issue with syncing WiFi and call customer service and they walked me though another way to sync the power station. It works great and I highly recommend. Thank you Anastasia Stepanchenko for your great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product So Far
customer_reviews.text: Works like is supposed to. SO much faster than standard wall charge that came with our 2020 Prius Prime. So far only improvement I would like to see is an enhanced APP. Current one has some nice features, but would like to see if get to the next level, maybe more statistics and reporting?
customer_reviews.author: John Phaklides

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Level 2 Charger
customer_reviews.text: This charge was super easy to install. It took me 15 minutes to install the bracket, hang the JuiceBox on the bracket and install the final screw to secure it to the wall. Plugged it in to the NEMA 14-50 socket and it looks great! Of course now I'm enjoying completely charging my Volt in 3-4 hours instead of 14 hours that it used to take with my 120 volt charger. I love the high quality - it looks like a professional installed it and the fact that I can control it with the app and with Alexa. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far works well no issues with setup of wifi and plugged in with no issue. I like that I can limit the Amp draw as I don't have it on a 50amp circuit at the moment.. Will eventually rewire to take full advantage of capacity but for now 30 amps seems to be plenty for my Bolt. Will update if have any issues
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great charger!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2013 Volt. This brought our charge time on 110V from 10 hours (approx) down to 4.5 hrs. (220V) Plug in is nice. App works great. Well made. So happy we are using our solar power to charge.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyFeather

customer_reviews.title: Plugged right in to a NEMA 14-50 receptacle
customer_reviews.text: We had an unused NEMA 14-50 circuit with surface mount receptacle for an electric stove. Simply moved it to the garage Our EV only draws 27.5 Amps, so set the JuiceBox to max at 30 A output. This let us use a 40 A breaker and 8 AWG wire that already existed. We like the email notifications about when the EV has started/stopped charging, and the email warning if it is not plugged in by a certain time (e.g. 10pm), in case we forgot.
customer_reviews.author: Mostafitty

customer_reviews.title: Charger for my Kona
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an electric Hyundai Kona and needed a level 2 charger that was UL tested and certified (for house insurance reasons). This unit was easy to install and charges my car with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: JuiceBox Pro 40
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My son installed it for me on my garage wall. Great for charging my Prius Prime. Thank you for a great product. FOLLOW UP. Will not buy again the power actually works on it, but there is no communication with my Wi-Fi. I should’ve read more reviews because I’ve had to replace this twice already for the same problem, looking for other friends to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DTM2D

customer_reviews.title: Can program charge current on the fly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. The app is very easy to use. Setup took some tries but once it connected never has an issue. You can program the charge current whichbis great since you typically want less current to prolong battery life.
customer_reviews.author: N. Obie

customer_reviews.title: Works well but had to replace it within 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Charges the car well and integrates well with my wifi system to give updates on charging. I only wish the plug holder attached to the box itself so it would be more compact. Also, the cord is very long, which is nice, but as the unit is positioned just next to my car in the garage it is actually kind of too long. After about 6 months, the box went dead, but Juicebox had a very competent return and replace service where they quickly sent a new box within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Good EV Charger
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are clear. Hire an electrician! Especially if you don't have a depth of experience wire high amperage wiring. It charges our cars well and the wifi control works easily too
customer_reviews.author: AmznAtomic724

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received quickly. My electrician did the install but it was easy for him and it works fine. This is being used with my new Nissan Leaf and the charging time is so much shorter with this! Very happy with this product. I have not hooked up to Alexa but am planning on doing that sometime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Guard

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and works great outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Setup took me multiple attempts using the app on a Google Pixel 2 since the phone wasn't finding the charger. I was starting to wonder if the unit was defective but after I got it setup, it works great. Easy to mount, just plug in and use it. Went through rain and snow, after installed on an outdoor rated outlet installed by an electrician, without any issues whatsoever. I love the WiFi integration and the integration with my Google Home as an added bonus and I hope they continue to develop it.
customer_reviews.author: grandmasterv

customer_reviews.title: Great, but unable to use the wireless
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to reset these boxes to get the wireless working. I followed the instructions and worked with tech support: I have 2 boxes with same issue. At first I thought it was my router distance. But it’s not. I purchased 2 new routers and I also ran a wire right up to the boxes and still they don’t see an network. By phone , iPad, computer will not see the boxes for set up either. I’ve even tried using the QR code with no luck. Wireless only worked for the 1st few weeks of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: John Antolino

customer_reviews.title: Works most of time
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had never bought this. It works OK most of the time but it frequently goes offline and with no reporting on charging usage. The app is confusing and the website is OK but it frequently loses my password and their reset password option does not so I have call tech support to get things going again. Don't buy it you will be disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Works, in theory
customer_reviews.text: Tech support non-existent. Unit failed after 18 months. Not possible to reset or repair. Contacted tech support several times without response.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vallarino

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to start charging
customer_reviews.text: Installed my Juicebox last week and so far it has been running great. I got the plug in version since I had already installed a 14-50 outlet a few months ago but had not pulled the trigger on a charger. I chose the Juicebox because it had the would charge at 40A and had many nice features compared to other stations in this price bracket. Installation went smoothly and once it was charging my Fiat 500e right away with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Gets Hot and Damages Ports
customer_reviews.text: Well, shortly after the period to return the product expired, this device got hot and melted a adapter to my Tesla. Then, it got hot and melted into my Leaf plug in. Spent all that money and afraid to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Clay Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good fast charger
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged, good instructions. I had some difficulty making the network connection because their server did not send the confirmation email for account creation. After several tries, and the passing of a couple of days, their server sent the required account confirmation email, and the networking was set up. The charger works great.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Man

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: Charges my electric car (2017 Chevy bolt) and provides good data. I'm saving so much on gas the car pays for itself. The charger is always reliable and never let me down. Unfortunately my utility company doesn't participate in the rewards program yet. I only pay 0.06 cents per kw and it's all from renewable sources. The electrical installation itself was very straightforward and anyone with intermediate electrical knowledge should be capable of running the line to breaker and installing the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed been having issues since the second month with it constantly disconnecting or the charge been interrupted. Last night it bit the dust.....
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great charger.  Very poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: As a charger it works great so far. Installation was very easy and it performs well. The app and connectivity might as well be nonexistent, however. I have yet to be able to get through the registration process to use the android app. There was absolutely no documentation about connectivity at all. The blue light is on indicating that it is connected, although I have no idea how since my wifi is secure and I didn't give it access.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin D Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Well built EVSE (Permanent install)
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install if you've got room in your panel. The 32A model allows my Chevrolet Bolt to charge as quickly as its on-board charger will let it. 32A is as much as most cars can take, so the 40A model is probably overkill for most non-Tesla owners. Nice piece of hardware and the software is definitely handy. I'd certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bagwell

product_meta.title: JuiceBox 32 Next Generation Smart Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Station with WiFi - 32 amp Level 2 EVSE, 25-ft Cable, UL & Energy Star Certified, Indoor/Outdoor (Hardwired Install, Black/Grey)
feature_bullets: Up to 6x faster charge: High-power, 32 amperes, 7.7 kW EV charging station. Indoor / outdoor installation. Built-in cable rack and security lock. UL listed. ENERGY STAR certified. Made in USA from domestic and imported parts. 3-year limited warranty for normal residential use.

Convenient WiFi connectivity: With the free JuiceNet app, control and monitor charging remotely, get notified when your car is fully charged, set reminders to charge, and more. Dynamic LED lights show charging status. Voice control via Amazon Echo / Alexa.
Smart grid savings: Schedule your charging times when rates are lower — making your electric vehicle even cheaper to drive.
Hardwire Installation: This unit is ready to be hardwired by a qualified electrician.
Rebates: Get it for as low as $79 after utility incentives available in many locations. Participate in the Enel X JuicePoints program to earn cash for smart charging in eligible geographies.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,076 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
